title: So spectating Challengers is all well and good.
body:
Until you realise that, those 200 (+10) players are rarely in games, and that there isn't actually a game to spectate.

Can we get the old in client spectate box that used to just find high ELO games (it used to be like D3+ nearly all the time), rather then this shit of "lets spectate.... no one because you have to work out when they actually play"

replies.body:
Generally, quite a few of these Challenger players also have streams on either Twitch or YouTube, and generally stick to a schedule, making it easier to watch when they play. 

Midbeast streams most evenings from 9pm NZDT, if you want to know a particular time. Unlike other Challenger streamers who play in Plat or Silver or something on stream, he streams on his Challenger account, the exception being when he is doing an *Unranked to Challenger*.

If you're into Top or Sin, there's Tilterella. 

If you like Mid or Annie, there's Panda Annie (#1 Annie OCE), who explains every little detail of what he's doing. He's not Challenger, but is high elo. 

But I agree. Having something in the client that expands from just the Challengers is a great idea!

Personally i don't like watching streams because i don't like using large amounts of data, and i don't really just want to watch ONE person, i want to watch multiple.

I get that if i want to watch someone streaming, then i'll go watch a big streamer, but i don't really want that.

I'd much rather be able to go into the client, and not have to look through 420 players, only to see none of them in game, and to have my time wasted.
